summary: This is a U.S. Attorney's Office press release announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell on charges of conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing and transporting minors, and committing perjury during 2016 depositions. It details the allegations of grooming and abuse spanning from 1994 to 1997 across multiple locations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing minors to travel for illegal sex acts and committing perjury in 2016 depositions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as Maxwell's co-conspirator in a scheme to sexually abuse minor girls as young as 14, with a known preference for young girls.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Announced the charges against Maxwell, stated Maxwell facilitated, aided, and participated in the sexual abuse of minors, and praised the investigative work.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Announced the charges, commented on Maxwell's disregard for the law and her role in luring vulnerable youth, and commended the bravery of the victims.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Announced the charges, described the crimes as abhorrent, and commended investigators for their commitment to bringing justice to survivors.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The case is assigned to her for judicial proceedings.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls, with Maxwell playing a critical role in facilitating Epstein's abuse.
Alleged to have befriended, groomed, and delivered minor victims to Epstein for sexual abuse, and in some cases participated in the abuse herself.
Alleged to have sexually abused minor girls, with the abuse facilitated by Maxwell.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in the morning and charged in Manhattan federal court with conspiracy to sexually abuse minors and perjury.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse Conspiracy
events.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein conspired to sexually abuse minor girls as young as 14 during this period.

events.title: Maxwell's False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Maxwell is charged with perjury for making several false statements under oath during depositions in a civil proceeding.

events.title: Indictment Unsealed
events.description: The indictment detailing the charges against Maxwell was unsealed in Manhattan federal court.

locations: New Hampshire (where Maxwell was to be presented in court)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including charges related to enticing and transporting minors.
The alleged abuse occurred from at least 1994 to 1997, with victims as young as 14, at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, and Maxwell's residence in London.
Maxwell is accused of playing a critical role in grooming victims by befriending them, taking them on outings, normalizing sexual topics, and being present during abuse to put victims at ease.
Maxwell is additionally charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath during 2016 depositions related to the allegations.
The case is being prosecuted by the U.S. Attorney's Office's Public Corruption Unit and is assigned to U.S. District Judge Alison J. Nathan.
